column1: If it is not treated within a few minutes, cardiac arrest usually causes death.
A heart attack can damage the heart, but it does not necessarily cause death.
Sometimes a heart attack can trigger a cardiac arrest, however.
CHD can clog the arteries in your heart, so the blood cannot flow smoothly.
A prior heart attack can create scar tissue that can lead to VF and cardiac arrest.
- Heart problems, such as congenital heart disease, heart valve problems, heart rhythm problems, and an enlarged heart can also lead to cardiac arrest.
Using certain drugs, such as cocaine or amphetamines, also increases your risk of cardiac arrest.
Most people do not have any symptoms of cardiac arrest until it happens.
